newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Banks says won't join cabinet if NZ's Peters does.
newsitem.headline: Banks says won't join cabinet if NZ's Peters does.

text.p: Tourism Minister John Banks said on Wednesday he would refuse to be part of a cabinet which included New Zealand First leader Winston Peters.
"I will not sit around a cabinet table with Winston Peters, because what Winston Peters stands for, I don't," the New Zealand Press Association reported Banks as saying.
National is negotiating with NZ First, hoping to form a coalition government. If that happens, Peters is likely to become deputy prime minister.
Banks, who is not expected to be re-appointed to cabinet anyway, said he could accept NZ First MPs Jack Elder and Peter McCardle as fellow ministers, but not Peters.
"I could sit around the cabinet table with Jack Elder and Peter McCardle because they are honourable Members of Parliament. Winston Peters -- no," he said.
"I don't know what Winston Peters is up to. All I know is that Winston Peters will be interested in doing the best business he can for Winston Peters, in the finest tradition of Winston first."
Final results for the Whangarei electorate were announced late on Tuesday, and Mr Banks increased his election night majority of 196 to 383.
